metadata.Title: CVE-2023-24056 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: In pkgconf through 1.9.3, variable duplication can cause unbounded stringexpansion due to incorrect checks inlibpkgconf/tuple.c:pkgconf_tuple_parse. For example, a .pc file containinga few hundred bytes can expand to one billion bytes.

criterions.comment: pkgconf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
